text:
‘THE OLDEST STATION IN THE NATION
UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN
MADISON
Bob Underwood
Network Manager
NAEB Radio Network
li|. Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
SEP 1 7 1958
_ ^ .19.1 I \
Dear Bob,
Sorry to have taken so long to reply to
your inquiry about Dahlgren* Enclosed is all the
information I have about the Swedish Radio and Teie-
vislon program service*
As to Dahlgren himself, he is the American
representative for this outfit* He is on the level,
but I don’t think he understands the programming of
educationat stations* The music ho has offered us so
far is not very interesting* We have used none of it*
And a look a his catalogue indicates that most of the
music which would interest us is already available
on records*
The kind of thing he has sent us is "musicale”
type stuff* Glossy arrangements of standard tunes,
some Swedish smorgasbord and so forth* It seems to
me that your Swedish musical offerings are far superior
to anything he might bo able to offer you*
However, I would look a little further into
his offer. He might be able to supply a limited murnbor
of programs for some dry spell in the future* The company
he represents seems to be on the make and might be useful
to NAEB in some way* As far as WHA is concerned, we are
not interested in music from the network* (except in rare
cases)
Which brings mo to another topic* I suggested
at one point that wo might offer i|.0 hour long lectures
on Indians which had been popular here. I have abandoned
the idea for the present because we are developing a new
series on a more modest basis. I’ll let you know what
happens* If they are good enough we’ll offer them*
The fourth quarter offering is particularly
juicy this time* We have scheduled most of it and are
waiting expectantly for the programs to start*
